history.content:
We are looking for a research assistant with excellent Matlab and/or R skills to work on data-driven analyses of environmental systems. We use machine learning and other big data methods to understand relationships between climate, hydrology and land cover in the West African Sahel.

The project investigates changes in the seasonality of rainfall in the West African Sahel. We use traditional data analysis techniques alongside neural network-based self-organizing maps. Data sets include both satellite and ground-based observational precipitation products.

The research assistant will aid in the development and application of big data methods to environmental data sets. The work will include data acquisition, pre-processing, and management; development and implementation of data processing pipelines; and exploratory data analysis. Advanced experience with programming required, R/Matlab preferred. Ideal candidate will be able to commit at least 8 hours per week. Paid position.

"Email cover letter and resume to mvangordon@berkeley.edu."
history.subject: Research Assistant: R/Matlab expert for Sahel precipitation trends analysis
